intro: Cyrtandra amicta, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded areas of rainforests. Its leaves are usually ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra amicta plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian flora.
